page.title: 02DRAYTON MANOR PARK 1
page.content: This present-day amenity area was once owned by Sir Robert Peel. The park covers 160 acres. This includes lakes and 15-acre zoo, extensive amusement parks, cafterias and restaurants,a garden-centre, a toy/novelty shop and a pottery shop. The zoo is well stocked with lions, bears, sea-lions, penguins, tropical birds, water fowl and llamas, to name but a few. The reptile house has a large selection of animals, and a farm section has most animals found on British farms. There is a pets' corner where children are encouraged to participate. There is a lost world collection of 24 types of dinosaurs, all life-size. A nature-trail covers 42 acres of woodland and water courses.
